Articles.Content:
I know there have been similar polls in the past, but I am interested in the current distribution since the console version has been released for a while now and I am not aware of any poll since then. In particular I want to know if the OS distribution has changed in the past year(s)...

So, what kind of OS do you use to run KSP? And do you have any reasons for using the one you do use?

 

Kubuntu 14.04 LTS - it's just that I prefer the KDE over Gnome and Unity...also since adding K to every word is one of the loading hints, I assume that KDE is the official DE of KSP?

Linux distribution: Ubuntu 17.04

Desktop environment: xmonad w/ gnome-panel and (recently) synapse

Edit: New Machine came today!

Edited July 27, 2017 by Geonovast

OS: Windows 10.

Reason: It came installed on the computer.
win 10
Windows 10, reason: am a masochist and love complaining about things.
WINDOWS 10 BECAUSE BECAUSE
Windows 8.1. Im not getting near Windows 10, to many negative reviews.
Another 14.04 Kubuntu user.

12 minutes ago, Gaarst said:

Windows 10, reason: am a masochist and love complaining about things.

Windows 10, I play other games that require it and it's easier for me to buy a laptop with a proper GPU on it if my wife feels like she can use it. I've also played on my work machine, which was Mint 17 for quite some time.

13 minutes ago, Gaarst said:

Windows 10, reason: am a masochist and love complaining about things.

Every OS is utter crap on some point.
Mostly Windows 10 but Ubuntu 16.04 LTS on my travel laptop.
Windows 10 because... Space Engineers and Elite Dangerous. Also because reasons.
windows 10 first edition, refuse to update err, downgrade
Anything but a console.

Debian testing, because that's what I've been running on my Linux machines since the late 90s. Window manager is Enlightenment, tracking the repository head. Didn't want to bother with a full-blown desktop environment, but wanted a bit more bling than the fluxbox install I have on other lightweight desktops.

Windows 7. While Windows 10 is, in my experience, a less annoying OS to interact with than 8.1 (and I don't even want to think about 8) 7 beats both in terms of least obnoxious to use.

I suppose I'll eventually need to move to Windows 10, but that can wait for a core hardware upgrade. I use 7 at home and both 7 and 10 at work, and some feature changes that took place after 7 are annoying bordering on frustrating; I've found some workarounds that help but I've never needed to worry about those issues with 7.

I'm really glad Linux exists and is a capable and enjoyable alternative to Windows, but I find that I appreciate Windows compatibility and ease of use over Linux's flexibility and price tag.

2 hours ago, NSEP said:

Windows 8.1. Im not getting near Windows 10, to many negative reviews.

I much prefer 10 over 8.  I liked 7 about the same as 10, with XP a bit behind.

Debian GNU/Linux testing, gnome desktop.

Edited July 24, 2017 by peteletroll
OS better specified.
Windows 7 x64

8 hours ago, Geonovast said:

Same here, the one and only Linux Mint 18 (Xfce Edition)
GNU/Linux, KDE Neon User Edition (Stable). The K Desktop and Kernel are cutting edge though.

Windows 10 - has not bothered me more or less than any other version - but I am just a gamer and know very little, do very little behind the scenes, so ...

Always wanted to try and see if KSP runs better under Linux - any insights?
Windows 7. I've been using it for pretty most of computer using life. I took have a windows 8 laptop, which I find just a hassle disguised behind a fancier UI, and I'm afraid to touch windows 10.

Kubuntu 16.10 with KDE (obviously).

I might switch to Debian with KDE when I next reinstall, though.
